page.title: 05THE BUTCHER'S SHOP
page.content: The butcher's shop has been in the Clarke family for three generations but was probably a cobbler's before that. It was situated at the bottom of a long street with houses and shops on both sides rising up the hill in{ {Haverton}towards{Cowpen Bewley.} Now the shop stands alone with a vacant space beside it used as a car park for the butcher's van and his faithful customers who travel in from Cowpen and Billingham etc.. The area is deteriorating all the time and the fight against the inevitable vandals makes life very difficult.The proprietor thinks that another five years should see the end of the area altogether.
